Checklist

Making Graphs Accessible

Enter descriptions

Contents
Graphs Colour Choice
Adding Alt Text To Graphs
  • Microsoft PowerPoint
  • Microsoft Word
  • Google Slides
  • Google Docs

Microsoft PowerPoint

Graphs Colour Choice

Ensures that colour is not the only method to convey information to accomodate students that may have colour vision deficiency (colour blindness)

    Step 1: Select "Colour" under the Design tab and select "Grayscale"

    Step 2: Ensure that the graph continues to convey the same information when in Grayscale

    Step 3: Rearrange the textboxes such that the text that should be read first is at the bottom of the pane

Adding Alternative Text to Graphs

Ensures that graphs contain text descriptions that can be read by a screen reader to help visually impaired students

    Step 1: Right click on the graph and select "Edit Alt Text"



    Step 2: Type 1-2 sentences to describe the graph and close the window to save

Microsoft Word

Graphs Colour Choice

Ensures that colour is not the only method to convey information to accomodate students that may have colour vision deficiency (colour blindness)

    Step 1: Select "Colour" under the Design tab and select "Grayscale"

    Step 2: Ensure that the graph continues to convey the same information when in Grayscale

    Step 3: Rearrange the textboxes such that the text that should be read first is at the bottom of the pane

Adding Alternative Text to Graphs

Ensures that graphs contain text descriptions that can be read by a screen reader to help visually impaired students

    Step 1: Right click on the graph and select "Edit Alt Text"



    Step 2: Type 1-2 sentences to describe the graph and close the window to save

Google Slides

Graphs Colour Choice

Ensures that colour is not the only method to convey information to accomodate students that may have colour vision deficiency (colour blindness)

    Step 1: Click "Format Options" along the top bar

    Step 2: Click "Recolor" on the right-hand-side panel and select any of the Grayscale options

Adding Alternative Text to Graphs

Ensures that graphs contain text descriptions that can be read by a screen reader to help visually impaired students

    Step 1: Select Right click on the graph and select "Edit Alt Text"



    Step 2: Type 1-2 sentences to describe the graph and close the window to save

Google Docs

Graphs Colour Choice

Ensures that colour is not the only method to convey information to accomodate students that may have colour vision deficiency (colour blindness)

    Step 1: Click "Image Options" along the top bar

    Step 2: Click "Recolor" on the right-hand-side panel and select any of the Grayscale options

Adding Alternative Text to Graphs

Ensures that graphs contain text descriptions that can be read by a screen reader to help visually impaired students

    Step 1: Select Right click on the graph and select "Edit Alt Text"



    Step 2: Type 1-2 sentences to describe the graph and close the window to save
